title: Move me to Cali
text: Nicole is absolutely amazing! She is the hardest working woman in her field! She is professional, consistent and very knowledgeable. Our family of 7 moved from Northern California to Southern California; which seems pretty stressful, right? Not at all! Nicole made our transition stress-free and painless. She knows movers, she knows housekeeping, but most of all, she knows what she‚Äôs doing. Her expertise shined. With her knowledge and experience of today‚Äôs market, she negotiated 40k over asking!  Never once did we feel out of the loop or confused. Her play by play communication is a superb. We always felt like we were her only clients. This incredible woman is living proof, that if you do what you love, it will exude you.  Thank you for all of your help Nicole our family is truly fortunate to have you.

title: Fisher plumbing
text: Nicole Johnson has been especially helpful with her expertise in scheduling the plumber to fix the condo above me‚Äôs shower leak and arranging the demolition crew to come in and meticulously take out all mold infested wallboard and wood etc.  Mark was the person sent to do this   He was a true professional.  Arrived on time with Lainey with smiling friendly faces and immediately prepared the site and after 4 hrs cleaned all carpet etc and took all contaminated material   The plumber Steve also arrived and completely fixed the leak in above condo shower - caulked around affected area and cleaned up in a total of 45 min.   All employees were enthusiast and happy and anxious to please.  Well done Fisher Plumbing. Now I‚Äôm just waiting for a refurbisher to be scheduled by Nicole to finish the project.  Excellent plumbing company.   Susie Maloof

title: I‚Äôve been using Google Maps since 2013
text: I owned Apple phone the majority of my life but I swore by google maps, no one could tell me otherwise I enjoyed all their features I always found google a step ahead of the game my absolute favorite navigation app that helped me since I was practicing to get my license. Now it‚Äôs a shame to call this app the worst, I‚Äôm writing this review because I‚Äôm deleting it, recently for these past couple of months not once or twice but MULTIPLE TIMES has this application taken me to the wrong place! How!?!? It‚Äôs so disappointing because I would recommend this app to everyone and now I‚Äôm just frustrated about all the time I‚Äôve had to turn around and look elsewhere to find the correct directions and I live Miami. I thought it just happened here but I went to Orlando the same exact thing happened! Never again I‚Äôm officially breaking up with google and using Maps from Apple.

title: Newer versions not as good.
text:
I still use google maps almost exclusively, but the past two times I‚Äôve updated I‚Äôve been left frustrated with. First off, the time and service signal are no longer displayed in landscape mode when directions are going. I travel full time and like to see what my cell service is in certain areas for work purposes. Now I can‚Äôt do that without stopping, exiting the app, and looking at my service bars. Really annoying. 

Secondly, when directions are going it no longer tells your total miles left to the destination, only the total time. That‚Äôs not always as helpful, especially if you hit traffic. Being able to see both time and distance left to destination is essential. 

Lastly, I have had way too many times where I choose an alternate route (not the fastest), but midway through the route it switches back to the ‚Äúfastest‚Äù route, taking me through areas I wanted to avoid. It‚Äôs incredibly frustrating. 

To sum it up, the app would be better if it showed the time and service bars while routing, showed time AND distance to the destination, and did not change the route to the fastest route after deliberately choosing a specific route (suggesting another route is fine, but default to no when doing so).

title: I truly love this app, but...
text:
I‚Äôve given 1 Star just to try and bring some attention to this issue. 

I‚Äôve happily used google maps basically ever since I owned my first phone. Yes, I have tried every other GPS app and I still prefer google maps. I love the timeline and the location sharing features (although I preferred them spatially where they were before they moved them). 

Now to the issue... I noticed a few days ago that my phone‚Äôs battery was consistently draining way faster than usual, and upon taking a look at the battery usage breakdown, I found that for the past few weeks google maps has been using a lot more battery than usual in what is started as ‚Äúbackground use‚Äù. I ran some tests and realized that if I didn‚Äôt open the app in the entire day and didn‚Äôt have it open in the background, it would consume 2-3% of my phone‚Äôs battery a day. But if I so much as opened it and didn‚Äôt terminate the background process, it would consume anywhere from 25-32% of my battery just by having opened it and not using the navigation feature. 

I figured it would be fixed with a future update but it hasn‚Äôt. 

Today, for the first time in 15+ years I considered looking for another alternative. Please fix this issue. I love this app! Keep up the hard work, google, well done! 

(I will happily change this review to 5 starts once and if this issue is resolved).

title: Zooming glitch on mobile app.
text: Whenever I zoom in on a location, the map will jump, or skip to a different area near where I am attempting to zoom in. This has been going on for over a year-and-a-half for me, and at least 2 other people I know have this issue. (One owns a Galaxy S10, and the other an iPhone. I own an iPhone 11.) This is especially an issue when I am viewing an unfamiliar area on the map. I have done everything I could think of, from getting a new SIM card, to resetting my phone, and nothing has worked. According to someone I spoke to about the issue, it may be a GPS issue. Not sure how else I can explain this. Basically, imagine having the map move to a different area at random moments when you are zooming in. Not sure what the cause is, or why such a stupid problem like this is even happening for in the first place. If I could use an alternative to Google Maps that has all of its features, without the zoom issue, I would.

title: New iPhone problems
text:
I recently moved from iPhone 7 to iPhone X‚Äôs. Most things seem to work well however Google maps has a major problem. I am not able to use the timeline future, and feel that it is because I cannot remove devices that I do not own or use. I have one iPad, and one iPhone, and yet google reports that I have two of each. When I go to settings to remove these devices there are no remove buttons so I‚Äôm stuck with them. 

Being frustrated in the effort to remove devices, I tried to change my password. I was sent to a screen that had scrambled letters which I had to enter in order to be able to change the password. I gave up after more than 20 tries of trying to read those letters and enter them correctly. So, I can‚Äôt even change my password. 

Is there any help available in this kind of situation? Thanks.

title: Mostly great but buggy and slow
text:
I generally like Google Maps a lot but, over the past few months, it has become incredibly slow when used with CarPlay. It used to work great but not anymore. I figured Google would fix the issue at some point but now I‚Äôm not so sure given how long the issue has been going on. The entire CarPlay interface becomes extremely slow. There is a significant lag of many seconds for every UI interaction like pushing a button. Really frustrating. 

 Another complaint is that Google Maps is, most of the time, confused about which direction you are heading when it first starts a route. You generally have to drive for about 1 block before the app figures out which direction you are headed. It then often updates the route or asks you to do a U-turn.

title: AT&T
text: So to start I found all these at&t stores you frequent in Indianapolis are considered retail stores, the staff is untrained and they really don‚Äôt know much about troubleshooting, then they have only 2 corporate stores that can really help solve problems the retail stores are designed to promise any and everything because they must sell equipment, with that being said when you go you should video tape, record everything they tell you, see that‚Äôs what I did so after I pay my bill for December I will be ready to take them to court for damages, and getting out this contract the things is I also recorded there worker telling me to take them to court because they have so many complaints that customer service don‚Äôt address so my reviews is if you go to Att in Indianapolis it‚Äôs a public place record as they talk to you because nothing they say is honest and I have to make sure I‚Äôm within my rights to use my recording to sue for damages

title: Home address is incorrect and no support to get corrected!
text: In 2019 when Google refreshed the map data it listed my address in the incorrect town. It is only two streets in my neighborhood that was messed up. All other streets are okay. This has caused HUGE problems for me. Deliveries cannot find my house because if you type in my address it doesn‚Äôt exist and will actually show a different location in my neighborhood as the place to go. I can‚Äôt get packages, I can‚Äôt get food deliveries, it‚Äôs just unacceptable. I have been trying for over six months to report this and get it resolved and there is absolutely no support!! I have reported via the web and the app to no avail. This is just ridiculous. I never had this problem before they refreshed all the map data. Literally only two streets in my neighborhood have the incorrect town. Is there no quality control prior to submitting data? There needs to be a way to report an error and get some sort of resolution.

title: The best of the map apps
text:
Personally, Google Maps wins over Apple Maps for two reasons:
1. Google Maps has more up to date information on business hours, road closures, etc.
2. When navigating, the gps updates in ‚Äúreal time"; i.e., it shows where you are that very moment, which is very helpful deciphering the turn by turn directions. On the other hand, Apple Maps shows your location with a slight delay-about a second, but that makes a big difference when it says to turn left, but there are still two intersections before where you're actually supposed to turn.
Bonus: Google Maps now integrates pretty seamlessly with Apple Car Play.

title: Google keeps removing its best features
text: Some of the best features this app had to offer that gave it an edge over other navigation apps have been removed slowly over time. One of my favorite features was for the option in settings to be told driving directions using the Cardinal directions instead of left/right. They removed this, but I got over it. Later, they made web integrations impossible to use inside of webpages (now it just has an ugly button that says "open in Google Maps"), and finally today they removed the ability to change how your lists are sorted, so now if you have a list it is forcibly sorted from most recently added to oldest added. I used to have lists for restaurants I want to go to and restaurants I like, and I had them sorted by nearest to me so that I could see restaurants nearest to me first. This is just terrible and this removal of key features is going to drive the app into its grave.

title: User hostile app
text: This app makes it easy - too easy - to save a location my "dropping a pin" on the map. The sensitivity for doing so is entirely too high and I end up leaving such marks frequently when simply scrolling around the map. Removing these unwanted dropped pins is about as fun as removing a tooth with neither assistance nor an anesthetic. Checking google for help is a labyrinth of either misinformation or refers to outdated versions that may or may not have used "blue arrows to get detailed location information where you can also delete the pin." Now my maps a populated with highlighted points of disinterest. This is quite unfortunate since directions and other details are rather good and effective were the app actually usable. I really wish I could use ugly words to describe how unpleasant the experience of using the app has become over the years. Please think of as many unpleasant curse words to as you can and insert them here.

title: Google is a company dedicated to deception
text: Googles UI/UX already forces you to navigate a labrynth to enable privacy options and now ironically will not give you the singular (turn by turn navigation) useful Maps functionality.. sans opting in to the very poorly market buzzword and consulting focus group‚Äôs combined sewage terminology of ‚Äúnavigation‚Äù - a lie and deception in nomenclature asside‚Ä¶ agreeing to opt in to crowdsharing and reliquinishing all your navigational data to google is a pre-req to usings the Maps app for what you use the Maps app for. Goodbye google. Your enterprise gsuite will fail, your storage platform google drive will fail, your browser will eventually fail as you are low barrier to entry but even lower on functionality. Thank you for confirming you are nothing but a deceptive and sinking advertising platform. You truly belong in the same breathe as your garbage peer, facebook. Advertise and thinkfluence away your low ceiling suite of apps and products, hello apple maps

title: Dislike the recent update
text:
Google maps as a useful tool is 5/5 to me, relatively accurate and gets me to places fast.

Before this recent update, you used to be able to swipe down to refresh the page in the transit options. But this recent update did away with that and doesn‚Äôt allow you to swipe down and refresh. Refreshing it before allowed to show the most recent, accurate results of say eta of busses, which bus route is most efficient, etc. Now if I want to refresh it, I have to close out the app or re-type and search again for the directions to my destination again.

I‚Äôd love if Google brought the prior format back, or if they want to keep the current new format, please at least introduce a clear and convenient way to refresh the page.

title: JDog Junk Removal & Hauling
text:
Last week I made an appointment to have junk in my basement and garage picked up. Three young people arrived right on time. 
A sister and brother from the JDog veteran family and a young man just home from Army Reserves. They were extremely efficient and courteous. The sofa from the lower level was large with large roll arms; but they worked it around the corner and out without making a mark on the walls. The sister was monitoring and making sure of safe removal. The price was very fair and to my delight i received a note in the mail with a Salvation Army receipt for the donation of two chairs. I liked the fact that i could support a veterans business that helps other veterans. I will definitely use JDog for any future junk removal or hauling. 
Janet

title: All Seasons of Birmingham Michigan
text: This place is not for every senior. If you place your loved one here be very cautious before signing anything. They only care about your money. The sales people present themselves as caring and loving but don‚Äôt be fooled. They are well trained to get you to sign on the dotted line. As soon as you sign before you even move in you will be out of pocket your deposit. My parents were fooled and me and my sisters were too. They made promises and led us astray.  They led us to believe they had the complete package that would allow my parents a comfortable place to live. After one year, we were out. Goodby All Seasons...please be cautious when thinking about all seasons for the one you love.

title: Terrible. App.
text: It doesn‚Äôt know where I am, tells me to turn on streets that I‚Äôm not near, spontaneously changes exits I‚Äôm supposed to get off on right when I‚Äôm up to them or after I‚Äôve passed them, I needed to go to a DMV in another city and it took me all the way through some random residential neighborhoods only to find out going home it was a half mile down the street from the freeway exit, and the latest gem is when I entered an address from my current location that I‚Äôve been to before, and it started directing me not to that address but to another address in my frequent list. I exited and restarted the route 3 times and it would not correct. I had to do a lot of local traveling this past week and I thought I would rip my hair out. I ended up having to use the Apple map and had no problems with it, this time. Everyone says to use Wayz so I will check that out instead. Sounds better than being totally lost and driving around like a crazy person.

title: What happened to directions?
text:
Google maps has been my preferred map app for years, but when I recently had to replace my old iPad, I was very disappointed to discover that searching for a location launches an inset window advertising restaurants, hotels, shops and points of interest near the location I searched for and blocking my view of fully half of the map. 
When I tried to map a route from point A to point B, the app again opened an inset window blocking half the map with a display of written directions.  In the past it was possible to minimize the former (much smaller) window, while retaining the location pin(s) and any route highlighting on the map, but now the only option appears to be to close the window completely, which erases this important information from the map.
This huge inset feature and the inability to minimize it severely reduces the utility of the app for its primary purpose ‚Äî mapping!

title: Still Lacking a Fluid & Consistent Experience
text:
There are three main issues that I have with this app that make it not very good to use. 
1:Lack of accuracy when it comes to what direction I‚Äôm going. At least half of the time when O start moving it shows me going in the wrong direction therefore has the directions going the wrong way. This is absolutely terrible when in an area you don‚Äôt know or are in a parking lot with no street names to reference.
2:This app consistently gets the end destination wrong. Whether it be that it ends me on the street behind my destination or in a large plaza saying I‚Äôve arrived. Also, the directions don‚Äôt take into account other entrances to plazas and will have you drive way out of the way to the plazas main entrance when one could save a few minutes by not having to wait at a red light to turn in.
3:No speed limit indicator. Please bring this feature back. Apple Maps has it, come on Google. It is a very convenient feature!

The directions and routes for the most part are good. However the UI is not the best nor are the directions displayed very intuitive nor informative sometimes. If Apple Maps had better execution I‚Äôd use them all day. However your app is NOT good. Since your directions are better and that‚Äôs what I need, you eek the competition by a hair...

title: Getting worse, very disappointed
text: I‚Äôve been using google map for years and mostly inclined to search the restaurant and places for social purpose, but I‚Äôm so disappointed with the real-time navigation, and this is the poorest functionality and destroyed all my good impression on this app. It‚Äôs so unstable and unclear when the route getting complex and has a great possibility of large latency under a huge traffic. It occasionally drives me mad when I‚Äôm being misled on a high speed way, and the voice just misguided me in a complicated fork and just waste a HUGE amount of my time to detour. I really hope there‚Äôs another mapping tool that can have a bigger social functionality and better navigation and more clear map information that I won‚Äôt hesitate to uninstall this and make my choice. Hope your team can put more efforts on the navigation design which should be the core competitiveness of your product.

title: Not easy to use measuring distance and adding points
text: I was using the app to locate small villages in Mexico to my surprise most villages my father mentioned were actually listed on google maps.  I was trying to measure distances while working on ancestry research to determine how far people traveled or moved in the 1900‚Äôs.  The measuring distance tool is basic.  I would like to see it updated where the distance between one location to another ends and if more points need to be added to other villages is not part of the same distance between point a and b.  I want to be able to measure point b to c separate not part of point a and b distance to know for sure how far or close are certain villages from each other.  Other than the annoyance above I like google maps for regular everyday use gps.

title: Publix shopping experience
text:
I was recently at my local Publix in Valrico commons shopping center and was helped in the seafood department by Jeremy. 
This gentlemen went completely out of his way to provide info on how to prepare a fish I‚Äôve never cooked before. After I left the seafood counter with my purchase, I was shopping for other items when he came and found me like 5 minutes later with a printed out copy of recipes. I was blown away that he took the initiative to go out of his way and provide excellent customer service on his own. I never asked him to do that. As a man that has been in this customer service industry my whole entire adult life, it‚Äôs nice to walk in Publix Ana always get a friendly smile.. great service and conversation.. I am a lifer.

title: Gregs Home Improvement & Maintenance   Kokomo,IN
text:
I want to thank you to Gregs Home Improvement for the very quick response to our issue.
We had a water pipe Break on us. It was spraying like a fire hose. Now this was 10:00 in the evening and I couldn't get the water to shut off. My wife got on her yelp app and Gregs Home Improvement was the first one we called. One ring and they picked up and had a crew at the house in 20 minutes. With all the Equiment to start removing the water. The damage was minimal due to the fast response that Gregs showed. I was very impressed. They where there till 3:00am and at 8:00 Mr. Burthay, the owner was at my house making sure all was taken care of and tested walls and floors with a moisture prob. You just don't see that kind of care and concern much anymore.

title: Used to Love
text:
I use this app daily for public transport information. Recently, they added a feature where you can check often what buses are running in your area without typing in a destination, which made it great. If I was mid travel & wanted to potentially change plans, I could see all my options. 

With the newest update, I have immense difficulty to find information on any route. They are forcing the home/work options and its positively awful. The devs want you to type in these two destinations and its extremely heinous to switch out the mode (honestly, I haven‚Äôt figured out how to make it stop doing this). I was so much time trying to figure out how to use this app, and if in an emergency or rush, could be screwed so easily. 

This recent update has made me go from loving this to researching replacement apps. I have absolutely no need for the home/work function, and it prevents me from using the app entirely, as I then can‚Äôt easily search for other routes.

title: Very flawed
text:
For people that need a good navigator, Apple maps is far better than Google maps in almost every way.

Google maps has priorities that will waste a lot of people‚Äôs time. It decides to load information about the road first, rather than loading information of the road itself. i.e. traffic instead of the actual route. because of this, it takes quite a while to load routes and reroutes, and by the time one is found, you‚Äôve missed a turn and the process starts again. it basically forces you to stop and find one ahead of time. 
Another problem is the fact that it doesn‚Äôt tell you the speed limit of the road that you are currently on.

BUT THE BIGGEST PROBLEM! a problem so big it basically renders googles map USELESS!!
Is that it calculates your routes based on distance, and not the speed of the roads. example: there are two routes you can take to your destination; a beltway and a b-line road straight to it. the beltway route is about 5 miles, but is posted at 70 mph and will take you no more than 7 minutes to get there. The b-line road however, is only 2 miles, but posted as 10 mph. guess which one it will choose?
This is pretty much exactly what happened to me. Google maps turned, what could‚Äôve have been a 10 minutes trip, to a full 40 minute one. This is just unacceptable.

How it is at the moment, Google Maps is pretty bad.

title: Dr. Marc Klein
text: Dr Klein is the best Podiatrist I have ever met and I have met many. My only regret is that I didn't meet him sooner. Meeting him sooner would have saved me a lot of money, time and most importantly pain. I had been to many foot doctors over the years and was almost to the point of giving up and accepting that I would have foot pain for the rest of my life. Upon my first visit I was assured by Dr. Klein that he would get rid of my pain and he did. He is kind, considerate, extremely competent and did his best to explain everything to me. Within weeks, I am now pain free thanks to Dr. Klein. If you feel like you have tried everything and are still suffering, please don't give up and give Dr. Klein a chance to help you. You will not be sorry that you did.

title: Becoming almost worthless in mega expressways
text: This app simply will not work on the high-volume expressways around NYC anymore, particularly on the NJ turnpike/garden state expressway around i95. After many of the toll stations there there will be as many as 6 or 7 exits to choose from and it overloads the app. The nomenclature the app uses to tell you which exit to take no longer matches any of the signage, so it‚Äôs impossible to know where to go by reading the signs, and it‚Äôs vague directions of ‚Äústay right‚Äù or ‚Äústay left‚Äù isn‚Äôt much help when there are still 4 exits to choose from on the left or right. With all the roads running parallel there in close proximity the app is also not sensitive enough to detect when you have made a mistake until it‚Äôs too late to do anything about it. Seriously, I challenge any of the app developers for this app to travel from i78 into the city via the tunnel using this app and not take a wrong exit.

title: Okay I guess, wasn‚Äôt what I expected.
text: So whenever I open the app everything is all normal and when I search up a food area I usually see if it‚Äôs busy or not but whenever I close the app and open it back up the live keeps changing like it‚Äôs busy but when I close it and open it back up again it says it‚Äôs not. I didn‚Äôt like how it kept doing that. Sometimes it happens while I go on it. Also a another thing is menu. So when I look for food around the app and check the menu they don‚Äôt have all stuff in the menu it will only have 3-5 items on the menu in the app but when I go to the food place in person there will be a bunch of stuff on the menu but when I go on the app it will have 3-5 items on it when‚Äôs more if you go to the food place in person. So the app is okay I guess, wasn‚Äôt expecting to see some mistakes üôÇ

title: Too many flaws and glitches so far on the game.
text: I do not understand what is going on with this app but there are too many glitches when it‚Äôs time to scroll throughout the map to navigate as well as the map orientation. More importantly the direction the map points towards as it‚Äôs giving navigational directions to any location. I stopped using Apple Maps a long time ago and I am a huge user of google maps since I travel a lot for work. But I‚Äôve been considering exploring other options and start contributing in something more reliable that it does not makes me get lost most of the time. These are flaws that did not used to happen before. Maybe Google needs to ease on spending money exploring our algorithms and listening to users and spend that money on perfecting their products to keep people connected.

title: This app is getting worse for some reason
text: It will reset your preferences regarding how you view the map (you can change this by tapping the compass icon) any time your phones physical orientation changes, such as flipping it over to put it in your cup holder, this is annoying af, sometimes it just changes on its own.  Also it‚Äôll totally just direct you to a place that may be sort of physically close to a location but it‚Äôs on the other side of a river or a ditch or something.  I‚Äôm a delivery driver and this app used to be pretty good but it gets worse and worse, and it‚Äôs costing me valuable gas and time on routes.  It also will choose to go through road closures despite there being a faster route that‚Äôs not even closed.  It has screwed me so often I have to double check the route before I go now, which is also annoying because zooming out will just trigger it to zoom back in half the time.

title: Not quite perfect
text: I would give google maps 5 stars if I had the option to see a map with the overview of my route displayed on my phone screen when using CarPlay. As it is now, I get step by step map directions on my car screen (that‚Äôs good) and a list of sentence directions for my entire route on the phone screen. Not only do I not have time to read an overview like that while driving‚ÄîI shouldn‚Äôt be! It‚Äôs unsafe. Seeing a map picture of the entire route would be much more helpful particularly when I‚Äôm using google maps for my commute and am fairly familiar with the various roads. I can see quickly if it‚Äôs having me deviate from the usual route further ahead to avoid a delay. At least having the option for a map overview instead of text would be nice.

title: A great app
text: Sometimes I use google maps over the default maps app my iPhone comes with. Other times I go with the default map over google maps. One thing that‚Äôll make me completely switch to google maps is if it gave me the option to avoid not just tolls and highways but states also. Reason why I would like this is because is I own guns and sometimes when I travel, I take them with me. Sometimes it‚Äôs the reason why I travel; to go hunt deer. Would be nice to have the app route give me routes that avoid states because my gun license is not honored by all 50 states in America. Conceal carry permit holders would benefit from this too. I still gave it a 5 star review because google maps has always been good to me.

title: Worst navigation app for driving!!!!!
text:
If your using this app for just looking up where something is. To get it‚Äôs name, phone number, or cross street. It‚Äôs great. But for use while driving.... THIS IS THE WORST APP IN THE WORLD FOR WHILE YOUR DRIVING! If you‚Äôre stuck in the downtown of a city you don‚Äôt know. You might want to use this to get the address to type into your gps for something else! Go with Tom Tom or Garmin. They‚Äôre all pretty cheap now. This app is a piece of crap! My biggest complaint is the fact it‚Äôll reroute you WITHOUT ASKING YOU! Pay close attention! It does it. I‚Äôve driven all over the country. I‚Äôll set it for one route that I wanna take. It‚Äôll start making changes without asking! My other big complaint. When you go to try to look for what exit number you‚Äôll be taking down the road.... it won‚Äôt tell you up at the top of the screen like it use too.

HEY GOOGLE! MAKE IT SO YOU CAN SEE THE EXIT YOULL BE TAKING 20 miles up ahead like you use to have it! GET RID OF THE LOOKING FOR A FAST ROUTE!

title: Head to head with Waze but still a distant 2nd place
text: I love the interface and graphics of Google maps way better than any other gps apps, but the lack of some basic but important features keep it lagging behind Waze. For one the fact that you have to get distracted and go to multiple screens to report a hazard or a police is annoying and dangerous, second after all these years of development I would like to be able to see the outdoor temperatures when I‚Äôm using CarPlay, my vehicle gets rid of the factory features when CarPlay is active and unlike on the app on my phone, my google maps don‚Äôt show the temp on my vehicle screen. Please take note of this for future updates as I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôm not the only one who loses this functionality when using google maps.

title: Management
text: I had a moped accidentally have the throttle stuck, I quickly picked it up and anyone that was inconvenienced I bought a drink and apologize to the whole area after that the issue was dropped except for by one employee I believe his name was Bob, I believe I also heard someone say he was drinking while managing the floor. I made a mistake but I made it right and just asked if I could please stay to drink a couple drinks being that I was sober upon arrival and it was a technical issue with the motorcycle. He embarrassed me and he threw me out even though no one else cared and he just wanted to flex his little tiny man power and throw me out for no reason all of the other bartenders and all of the other patrons said he was being irrational and that that is not how somebody who manages a floor should act it‚Äôs like he has not had training and this is the second time he has done this to me unless I get an apology I will not be going back

title: Horrible
text: This is the worst navigation app I‚Äôve ever used. I drive DoorDash, and Google Maps is unfortunately the navigation we use. The app rarely if ever knows my orientation, which makes it difficult to know which way to head or which road to turn on. When I‚Äôm going to an apartment complex (each building with separate addresses), the app plants me in the middle and I have to wander around to find the correct building. Earlier today, I was in a delivery and the app decided to take me onto the interstate. Come to find out, it had no idea where it was taking me. It expected me to get off the interstate and take a sharp right (not off at an exit, just straight off the interstate). This added about 10 minutes to my delivery. I‚Äôve had nothing but issues with this service and it‚Äôs crazy to me that a company as big as google can‚Äôt create a navigation tool that works. Stick to your default map application.

title: Infuriating Bug
text:
While I have used Google Maps happily for several years, currently it seems impossible (on iOS 14.8) with the most recent version of Google Maps, to list a missing place. At times ‚Äúfood & restaurants‚Äù doesn‚Äôt even appear as a category. When I get past that step it asks for location. Well enough, but then it doesn‚Äôt let me complete any more information. Meanwhile, if I try to go to ‚Äúlocated inside another establishment?‚Äù (it‚Äôs not) I‚Äôm taken to a blank page and can‚Äôt return to complete hours, contact info, etc. 

Fix this bug and I‚Äôll return to a five star rating but this is fundamental to your business model. You need those of us who take the time to add this info in order to keep up with and expand your database. 

Thanks in advance for your attention.

title: Route Options not working
text:
With the latest update, the Route Options buttons have stopped working. Tried reinstalling the app twice. 

-----------------------------------------------
Since the latest update, there is a problem. When using the directions screen, the displayed directions do not update. The next direction does not show the distance reducing as I approach it, nor does it disappear after passing it. If I go to the main map screen and then back to the directions screen, the directions are updated, but once again, they are frozen when I stay on that screen. The voice directions and the main map screen work normally. I tried deleting and reinstalling the app, to no avail.

title: Google maps updates
text:
I use google maps for everything I do! I travel for work do it is a perfect app for me! Well used to! Now that they updated the last update I started to hate it app. Why? Well because before I was able to see many stores or hotels near me and switch in between them without an issue and now it became more problematic after the update. I noticed that if I search one area let‚Äôs say for a Res Roof Inn and then want to see same in 50 miles away from
Where I am it gives me an issue and brings me back as to where I am located and if I press the location before it would just pop up with all the info now it zooms in to the location and I loose all the other places. I don‚Äôt know how to explain all the issues with the map now what I know is that it because more problematic and I wish I can go back to the map settings that I had before the last 2 updates!

title: Here There & Everywhere
text:
Buoy I tell ya they might call it the Great Reset but sometimes I get tired of all the Set‚Äôn around and not doing much save for talking to everybody, from my entire family to all my doctors, via video conferencing. 

Sometimes I just wanna put the pedal to the metal and  head out on the highway but ya know safely, hovering right around the local speed limit. This is why I prefer Google Maps over most other mappy apps. 

Just like my family it reminds me where all the most frequented addresses are and like my doctor it tells me where I last picked up all my prescriptions. All this along with the quickest route there, what time I‚Äôll arrive so I know to crank-up my favorite classic rock tune, revving me up before I stroll in wearing muh sunglasses. 

But most of all unlike my ex-wife, it‚Äôs got the sweetest good natured voice ya ever wanna hear screaming at how ya might miss the next turn but always coming thru safely, right up until the very last second. Not to mention I can always add another stop to my route. Google Maps makes my routine rounds kinda cool again. 

Righteously yours, 
Gordon Leadfoot

title: Needs better "next step"
text: While I see the value in only seeing one step at a time; I frequently find myself getting lost when I have to run into the city because I don't have the exits all memorized (or I wouldn't need GPS) and Google doesn't provide me with enough information to choose from multiple lanes. I can't count how many times it says take the left two lanes or displays just an exit, and then I find I needed to be in the left most ( not either of the left lanes) to catch my split when the road forks and I wind up going the wrong direction because it was too late to get over in moving traffic once Good decided to tell me I actually need to get over. It needs to be better in major metropolitan areas to give you WAY more advanced notice somehow as you might have to shift over a mile in advance and not right before...

title: Who Broke Google?!
text: Usually I can figure out anywhere to go on the bus/metro but as of today I ran into a situation. Trying to figure out just alone to get from Cincinnati to Kentucky (not hard at all) so all you would have to do is put your plain address in or Your Location to the next place but  instead it gives like 5-6 buses and then no time except to get on those buses at night but when I use the transit app it tells me exactly what buses to take..the only thing is google good for is getting you lost!! In my opinion!!! I‚Äôm glad I found this out prior to it then for actually getting on the go and then getting lost before arriving and leaving to and at said location. Who broke Google?! That‚Äôs all I got to say especially when you just search things in general. Come on it‚Äôs either fact/opinion people let‚Äôs keep it at that for Godsake

title: Geared for EVs; not environmentally friendly for gas vehicles
text: Google Maps used to be my go-to map app, but lately I‚Äôve noticed that the directions have me going through the most congested locations of the city to help cut down on the number of miles that I need to drive. This has resulted in doubling or tripling my drive time and decreasing the efficiency of my gas vehicle.  I appreciate Google‚Äôs attempt at reducing carbon emissions by reducing the number of miles we drive, but it is not helping people who still drive gas vehicles. Google Maps should have separate gas vehicle and electric vehicle options in an effort to reduce emissions and air pollution. I am retiring my use of Google Maps until I am able to switch to hybrid or electric. Google needs recognize that their new system of routing for less miles and city traffic driving is actually causing further harm to the environment because most people still drive gas vehicles.

title: Great app but recent updates have been questionable
text:
Google Maps is amazing. Idk if their UX/product management or something changed, but recently they‚Äôve pushed some bad UX updates IMO‚Ä¶

* When viewing a location photo, double click zoomed the photo and swipe went to the next photo. Now single click and swipe both go to next photo. To zoom you must punch which takes two hands to do comfortably. This is a pain since zooming photos is a very common user behavior.

* When in navigation mode, I used to be able to freely swipe around to other areas, and click a button to return to following my arrow thingy. Now when I swipe it activated this weird panning that I can‚Äôt control. Seems arbitrary and I still don‚Äôt understand it as I don‚Äôt think the behavior is always consistent.

title: Left turns in LA
text:
Now, I spend a lot of time on this app - I trust it more than Apple Maps, and even use it to read reviews instead of Yelp! I just recently moved to LA, so I‚Äôm relying on Google Maps even heavier than I usually do. It‚Äôs been somewhat helpful, although my one serious gripe about using it while driving, is that it somehow always defaults to guiding you to turn left. 

If you‚Äôve ever been to a busy car-reliant metropolis like Los Angeles, you know that left turns are a very specific type of nightmare (especially for the uninitiated). It is very rare that they are controlled here. For the love of god, I‚Äôm begging you to please stop telling me to turn left on major highways and 8-lane streets! There are other, much safer options. Why is this the default?

title: Completely freezes my device when exiting out the app
text: I've never had an issue with the app before but over the last few recent updates I've been encountering this bug where everytime I'm done searching or exploring something as in tap on the 'x' to cancel out or when I arrive at my destination and it goes back to its usual 'homepage' and I swipe up to get out of the app or go to my phone's home the app freezes my entire device and bricks it for a good couple minutes where I can not do anything at ALL. And then it'll either reboot my device or quit everything and put it into a black screen with the spinning/loading icon. I'm on the iPhone X with the latest updates installed on it. I know for a fact that it isn't my phone and just this app because it only happens with Google maps, as soon as I swipe up to go the my phone's homepage and no other app. Been a week or two now.

title: Why use Google Maps?
text: You simply will not find a more powerful human directional guidance app on the internet.  This extraordinary application is simply the best.  It has the development and brilliant minds of the Google Team forever updating and finding ways to improve your experience and it has teams of Google Guides ( regular folks like myself ) on all corners of the world to help you decide which places to visit, restaurants to try, providing honest business reviews, word of mouth reviews that you will find extremely helpful.  I am grateful for this top rate technology every day I utilize to help make my life and the lives of others just a little easier in these unprecedented times.  All the best to you, wherever you are on the Globe. - Jo

title: Completely Ruined
text: This use to be the best navigation app out there but recent changes in the apps behavior is down right disturbing. While the app still shows alternate routes, it will change your selected route when it decides too and without notification often leading you in a completely different direction. This is not being done to re route because of construction or traffic mind you. This is on top of pop ups for toll roads that have an automatic timer that will re route you to them unless you respond to the notification within the time limit.  This causes you to have to constantly monitor the behavior of the app since it will no longer follow the chosen route which is down right deceptive and dangerous. I have since had to revert to Apple Maps after several instances of this behavior and am seeing that hundreds of other users are experiencing the same behavior.

title: IDk man, I love and hate. A little too much tracking
text:
I don‚Äôt know man, I really don‚Äôt know how I feel about this service. Like most people today I‚Äôm horrible with maps and have a horrible sense of direction. This app has never failed me. It makes everything so much easier. It‚Äôs helped me with navigating through small little country roads no one would know but their great grandpa. 
It‚Äôs also helped me navigate to the nearest gas stations, restaurants, and gyms in big cities I‚Äôve never been in before. 
Trust me, I‚Äôm not a paranoid ‚Äúbig brother‚Äù is watching type at all. 
It‚Äôs been very helpful. 

BUT... I was messing around with some of the features tonight, and I‚Äôve learned that it‚Äôs been tracking my every move. 

Literally. A little too much, like it‚Äôs assumed stops at places that I‚Äôve never been, But most likely walked or driven by. 

It‚Äôs been tracking my every move for the past 6/7 years.
 
EVERYTHING. 
Things and places I don‚Äôt even remember until I re-discover them through my location history. 

Lol I ain‚Äôt bout this. 

Hopefully this review is helpful to you. I want you to take this with a light heart (because it‚Äôs funny), but also, realize how much of yourself (privacy) that you‚Äôre giving to these companies and developers.
